title: Looking for a Modern Round Font
content:
I'm in the process of designing a logo and need a modern round font, similar to [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/process/bryant_2_pro/).

Any suggestions?
author: Acedro Todd

comments.content:
Depending on your target group, the freebie Naiv Fat from Die Gestalten might be a nice alternative.  
 [http://die-gestalten.de/fonts/freefonts/details.html?id=12](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/die-gestalten.de/fonts/freefonts/details.html?id=12)

Thanks but my client is the conservative type.

Ace Inc. Marketing & Communications  
 [www.aceincmarketing.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.aceincmarketing.com/ "www.aceincmarketing.com")

what about that one - not rounded end - although rounded glyph aspect: [http://www.marksimonson.com/article/118/proxima-sans-going-nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.marksimonson.com/article/118/proxima-sans-going-nova "http://www.marksimonson.com/article/118/proxima-sans-going-nova")

Sim,

Not quite what I'm looking for, although I do like it.

Thanks

Ace Inc. Marketing & Communications  
 [www.aceincmarketing.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.aceincmarketing.com/ "www.aceincmarketing.com")

Marcox,

Spot on!

Thanks

Ace Inc. Marketing & Communications  
 [www.aceincmarketing.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.aceincmarketing.com/ "www.aceincmarketing.com")

I like [VAG Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/vag-rounded/) and Neutraface Text Light ( [www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts "www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts")).  
Alternatively, [Los Niches](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000269) from Veer.  
Bye.
What about the excellent [Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000003) by Nick Cooke?

There's also Sylvia (by Alias). ( [http://www.t26.com/fonts/Sylvia\_Complete](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Sylvia_Complete "http://www.t26.com/fonts/Sylvia\_Complete"))  
Although, I'd like to see this without gaps in the figures.

I'd be more pleased by FF Speak, if there was not this misshapen lower case "g". My opinion only, of course.

// alex

You guys are awesome. What a useful forum.

Ace Inc. Marketing & Communications  
 [www.aceincmarketing.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082311/http:/www.aceincmarketing.com/ "www.aceincmarketing.com")
